title: [Self-directed] Multi-IRS-Aided MIMO-NOMA Network Optimization Design Course

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Wireless Communication Concepts, Foundations of Linear Algebra, and Introduction to Optimization Theory
context.additional_context: Practice-oriented training to solve real-world communication system optimization problems in industrial settings

learning_goals: An adaptive user pairing strategy can be designed to minimize inter-user interference in MIMO-NOMA systems within multi-IRS environments
A numerical analytical approach can be implemented to calculate precoding matrices and IRS phase shift values that maximize spectral efficiency under base station power constraints
A real-time optimization solution prediction model utilizing deep learning frameworks can be developed and validated through performance verification processes
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
